Resolved Question Show me another » What is a blue-plate service style? And a tray service style? Blue plate and tray service style is what i really need... thanks! 6 years ago Report Abuse by lochmess... Member since: January 17, 2007 Total points: 17,865 (Level 6) Add Contact Block
Best Answer - Chosen by Voters Blue plate special is or was the special of the day, actually the cheapest meal of the day served in restaurants. Don't really think they use the term any more. Began around the 1920's, it would usually be put on a different color plate, not always blue, at least by the 50's, but maybe it was blue back in the 20's, quite a bit before my time, so can't know exactly about that. Tray service is where you take a tray and go to an area like a cafeteria and you pick up your own food, like in schools, and sit down and eat. You don't have any waitress service. 6 years ago Report Abuse 67% 2 Votes 2 people rated this as good

by Jakarta Worker Member since: April 06, 2006 Total points: 14,523 (Level 6) Add Contact Block OK,"Lochmessy"is wayyyyy off!!!
What she thinks is tray service is actually self-service or buffet service. And her blue plate"special"is correct but not the information you need (I'm sure.)
Tray service is when practically EVERYTHING (but your food) you want is brought to you on a tray. Your drink, an extra plate, ketchup, a salt shaker, ANYTHING, is brought to you on a tray. This is also known as french service.
Blue plate service is casual dining service. Where proper serving techniques are not enforced, your plates are yelled out and when you hear yours, you raise your hand to your server to let them know it's yours. 6 years ago Report Abuse 33% 1 Vote
